dataset.title: CSPs: Herb layer composition and abundance in the central plot of the CSPs

creator.organizationName: Institute of Botany / Geobotany and Botanical Garden Martin Luther University Halle-Wittenberg

abstract.para: We performed an extensive vegetation survey of the central plots of each CSP in GNNR in 2008. Herb layer communities can serve as ecosystem functioning variable, which is of importance for all community and ecosystem-based statements. We made a detailled description of the herb layer communities in the central plot of each CSP. Herb layer includes all vascular plant species and individuals below 1m height. The vegetation survey includes the identification of all individuals, species abundance was counted, species were classified according to their life form. The presence of tree and shrub seedlings (i.e. woody recruits) in the herb layer can act as an indicator for regeneration.
The vegetation survey always was done before other subprojects were working in the central plot. This ensure best possible results for seedling numbers.

keywordSet.keywordThesaurus: Find the list of keywords here: https://china.befdata.biow.uni-leipzig.de/keywords
List of headers of the data columns in this dataset

intellectualRights.para: Permission is granted to anybody to access, use and publish all open for public data freely. The commercial use of any data is prohibited. The quality and completeness of data cannot be guaranteed. Users employ these data at their own risk. In order to make attribution of use for owners of the data possible, the identifier of ownership of data must be retained with every data record. Users must publicly acknowledge, in conjunction with the use of the data, the data owners. Cite the data as follows: Erfmeier, A. and Both, S. (2008):Herblayer composition and abundance in the central plot of the CSPs. BEF-China data portal (Accessed through URL http://china.befdata.biow.uni-leipzig.de/datasets/186)

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: The study was performed in the 27 Comparative Study Plots (CSPs) in Gutianshan Nature Reserve.

taxonomicCoverage.generalTaxonomicCoverage: The vegetation record dealt with herb layer only, i.e. vegetation below a height of 1 metre. While the vegetation record (i.e. cover and abundance of each species) was performed at central plot level the additional vegetation list (i.e. occurance of herbaceous species) was done at whole plot level.

taxonomicClassification.commonName: The vegetation record dealt with herb layer only, i.e. vegetation below a height of 1 metre. While the vegetation record (i.e. cover and abundance of each species) was performed at central plot level the additional vegetation list (i.e. occurance of herbaceous species) was done at whole plot level.

description.para: CSPs: Herb layer composition and abundance in the central plot of the CSPs

We performed an extensive vegetation survey of the central plots of each CSP in GNNR in 2008. Herb layer communities can serve as ecosystem functioning variable, which is of importance for all community and ecosystem-based statements. We made a detailled description of the herb layer communities in the central plot of each CSP. Herb layer includes all vascular plant species and individuals below 1m height. The vegetation survey includes the identification of all individuals, species abundance was counted, species were classified according to their life form. The presence of tree and shrub seedlings (i.e. woody recruits) in the herb layer can act as an indicator for regeneration.
The study was performed in the 27 Comparative Study Plots (CSPs) in Gutianshan Nature Reserve.

The vegetation record dealt with herb layer only, i.e. vegetation below a height of 1 metre. While the vegetation record (i.e. cover and abundance of each species) was performed at central plot level the additional vegetation list (i.e. occurance of herbaceous species) was done at whole plot level.

samplingDescription.para: The CSPs were established in May - June 2008 in the Gutianshan Nature Reserve as well as outside the Nature Reserve. The CSPs have a size of 30 x 30 metres and are exposed to the north. The central plot hold a size of 10 x 10 metres and is situated in the centre.
With this data, herb community analysis from the CSPs can be performed. Mind that the cover values only apply to the central subplot.

dataTable.entityDescription: CSPs: Herb layer composition and abundance in the central plot of the CSPs

attribute.attributeDefinition: The scientific species fullnames are based on the "Flora of China" identified by Teng Fang and verified by Helge Bruelheide (trees) and Alexandra Erfmeier (herbs). Scientific species names consist of epithet and genus. For identification, the Author name and the year of the publications of the description are required. (species: species present in the central plot of the respective CSP)

textDomain.definition: The scientific species fullnames are based on the "Flora of China" identified by Teng Fang and verified by Helge Bruelheide (trees) and Alexandra Erfmeier (herbs). Scientific species names consist of epithet and genus. For identification, the Author name and the year of the publications of the description are required.

description.para: Scientific plant species name

The scientific species fullnames are based on the "Flora of China" identified by Teng Fang and verified by Helge Bruelheide (trees) and Alexandra Erfmeier (herbs). Scientific species names consist of epithet and genus. For identification, the Author name and the year of the publications of the description are required.
species present in the central plot of the respective CSP
